body.p: Your Petitioner A. Smith would respectfully represent that at the last July term of the Equity & criminal court in Warren County he was fined ^Sixty dollars^ on an Indictment for Retailing Spirrits without a licens your petitioner pleads guilty to the charge but the offince was committed during the time of the Rebelion & while Kentucky was over run by rebels -- your petitioner was and is a verry poor man with a family of Small children and felt he was forced to do Some thing to make Some money and did Buy a Jug of Whiskey & take it to a public Sale a retail it under the advice of Some friends & neighbors Sober good citizens your petitioner further states he has never made a practice of pedling Spiritous Liquors and never intends to is in favor of the enforcement of the laws -- the restorative of the union under the constitution and will go and Sin no more. and would pray your Excelency to remit the fine and will Ever pray
Sworn to by Allen Smith before the undersigned this the 1" day of October 1864
H Y Gardner J P W C

The undersigned Loyal Citizens of Warren County would Represent that they are well acquainted with the within named A. Smith the petitioner and know him to be a know him to be a verry poor man a Steady good citizen not given to violating the laws -- and would most respectfully present his case as one worthy Executive clemency and ever pray
